plentry.pd: 0: Auto mode. This is the default mode enabled by the SDK. In this mode, the SDK first tries to connect via SD-RTN™. If that fails, it automatically switches to TLS 443.
1: UDP protocol cloud proxy, i.e., Force UDP mode. In this mode, the SDK always transmits data using the UDP protocol.
2: TCP (encrypted) protocol cloud proxy, i.e., Force TCP mode. In this mode, the SDK always transmits data using TLS 443.
0: Automatic mode. This is the default mode. In this mode, the SDK first tries to connect via SD-RTN™. If it fails, it automatically switches to TLS 443.
1: UDP cloud proxy, i.e., Force UDP mode. In this mode, the SDK always transmits data via UDP.
2: TCP (encrypted) cloud proxy, i.e., Force TCP mode. In this mode, the SDK always transmits data via TLS 443.
0: Automatic mode. This is the default mode enabled by the SDK. In this mode, the SDK first attempts to connect to SD-RTN™. If the connection fails, it automatically switches to TLS 443.
1: Cloud proxy using UDP protocol, also known as Force UDP mode. In this mode, the SDK always transmits data via UDP.
2: Cloud proxy using TCP (encrypted) protocol, also known as Force TCP mode. In this mode, the SDK always transmits data via TLS 443.
0: Automatic mode. This is the default mode. In this mode, the SDK first connects to SD-RTN™. If it fails, it automatically switches to TLS 443.
1: UDP protocol cloud proxy, i.e., Force UDP mode. In this mode, the SDK always transmits data via UDP.
2: TCP (encrypted) protocol cloud proxy, i.e., Force TCP mode. In this mode, the SDK always transmits data via TLS 443.
